sen.j: 柳生藩（やぎゅうはん）は、大和国添上郡柳生郷（現奈良市柳生地区）を治めた藩。
sen.e: Yagyu Domain was the ruler of Yasyugo Village, Sonokami no kori County, Yamato Province (modern day Yagyu District, Nara City).
Yagyu Domain was the ruler of Yagyu-go Village, Sonokami no kori County, Yamato Province (modern day Yagyu District, Nara City).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Yagyu Domain was the ruler of Yagyu-go Village, Sonokami no kori County, Yamato Province (modern day Yagyu District, Nara City).

sen.j: 石高1万石程度の小藩であったが、藩主の柳生氏は代々将軍家の剣術指南役として幕閣に重きをなした。
sen.e: Although, it was a small domain with ten thousands koku, the role of Yagyu clan (the load of the domain) always carried weight as an instructor of swordplay in the Shogun family for generations.
Although, it was a small domain with the crop yields of 10,000 koku, the lords of the Yagyu clan always carried weight as an instructor of swordplay in the Shogun family for generations.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
sen.e: Although, it was a small domain with the crop yields of 10,000 koku, the lords of the Yagyu clan always carried weight as an instructor of swordplay in the Shogun family for generations.

tit.cmt: 小タイトルのため、一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 藩祖である柳生宗矩の死後、1万2500石の所領は、有名な長男の柳生三巌（十兵衛）に8300石、三男の柳生宗冬に4000石、四男の六丸（列堂義仙）に200石、と分知されたため、柳生氏は大名から旗本となった。
sen.e: After Munenori YAGYU's death (the original forefather of the domain), because the territory of twelve thousands five hundred koku was divided into eight thousand three hundred koku for the well known 柳生三巌 (Jubei) the first son, four thousand koku for 柳生宗冬 the third son and two hundred koku for Rokumaru (Gisen RETSUDO), the Yagyu clan became hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) from daimyo (Japanese feudal lord).
sen.cmt: 柳生三巌 読み方不明 柳生宗冬 読み方不明
sen.e: After Munenori YAGYU's death (the forefather of the domain), because the territory of 12,500 koku was divided into 8,300 koku for the well known Mitsuyoshi YAGYU (Jubei) the first son, 4,000 koku for Munefuyu YAGYU the third son and 2,000 koku for Retsudo Gisen, the Yagyu clan became hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) from daimyo (Japanese feudal lord).
sen.cmt: 人名の読みを追加しました。アラビア数字に変更しました。
sen.e: After Munenori YAGYU's death (the forefather of the domain), because the territory of 12,500 koku was divided into 8,300 koku for the well known Mitsuyoshi YAGYU (Jubei) the first son, 4,000 koku for Munefuyu YAGYU the third son and 2,000 koku for Retsudo Gisen, the Yagyu clan became hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) from daimyo (Japanese feudal lord).

sen.j: 三巌の死後、宗冬がその家督と遺領を引き継いだ（4000石は幕府に返上）。
sen.e: After 三巌's death, 宗冬 became the successor to the Yagyu clan and inherited the property (but, returned four thousand koku to bakufu).
After Mitsuyoshi's death, Munefuyu became the successor to the Yagyu clan and inherited the property (but returned 4,000 koku to bakufu).
sen.cmt: 人名の読みを追加しました。アラビア数字に変更しました。
sen.e: After Mitsuyoshi's death, Munefuyu became the successor to the Yagyu clan and inherited the property (but returned 4,000 koku to bakufu).

sen.j: さらに寛文8年（1668年）1700石を加増され、1万石を領する大名に復帰する。
sen.e: In 1668, having another one thousand seven hundred koku added, Yagyu clan returned to the position of daimyo (Japanese feudal lord).
In 1668, having another 1,700 koku added, Yagyu clan returned to the position of daimyo with the 10,000 koku.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字に変更しました。一万石 を追加しました。
sen.e: In 1668, having another 1,700 koku added, Yagyu clan returned to the position of daimyo with the 10,000 koku.
They opened a government building of domain called Yagyu jinya.
They established a government building of domain called Yagyu jinya.
They established a government building of domain called Yagyu jinya.

sen.j: 代々の藩主は将軍家の剣術指南役を務めるため江戸に定府していた。
sen.e: The lords normally stayed in Edo for generations to act as an instructor of swordplay for the Shogun family.
The lords normally stayed in Edo for generations to act as an instructor of swordplay for the Shogun family.
The lords normally stayed in Edo for generations to act as an instructor of swordplay for the Shogun family.

sen.j: 以後、柳生氏が13代にわたって支配し、明治時代を迎えた。
sen.e: The Yagyu clan was the ruler for next thirteen generations until the Meiji period.
The Yagyu clan was the ruler for the next 13 generations until the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: アラビア数字に変更しました。
sen.e: The Yagyu clan was the ruler for the next 13 generations until the Meiji period.
Fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family)-twelve thousands five hundred koku- eight thousand three hundred koku-ten thousand koku.
Fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family): 12,500 koku - 8,300 koku - 10,000 koku
sen.cmt: アラビア数字に変更しました。
sen.e: Fudai daimyo (a daimyo in hereditary vassal to the Tokugawa family): 12,500 koku - 8,300 koku - 10,000 koku
